definition: everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: The singer's performance gained a whole cheers.
sentences.chinese: 歌手的表演获得了满堂彩。

sentences.english: What is a Full House in Poker?
The film had earlier brought down the house at its preview for journalists in China.
sentences.chinese: 在之前的媒体看片会上，影片博得了在场记者满堂彩。

sentences.english: After this words was out of her lip, she immediately access to the applause sound.
sentences.chinese: 此话出唇后，立刻获得满堂彩声。

definition: to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
adverse audience reaction: boos and jeers, hissing, catcalls or deliberate applause after a mistake
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
